sections.heading: Everest Panorama Trek Overview
articles: The Everest Panorama Trek is the perfect introduction to Everest region trekking for those with limited time or first-time mountain experience. Over 10 days, you'll experience authentic Sherpa culture, visit ancient monasteries, and witness stunning mountain views without pushing into extreme altitude. Maximum altitude is only 3,880m (Everest View Hotel) - well below altitude sickness risk. The trek features proper acclimatization time in Namche Bazaar, scenic walks to key viewpoints (Everest View Hotel, Syangboche, Tengboche Monastery), and opportunities to explore local life. Perfect for busy professionals, families with teenagers, and anyone seeking genuine Himalayan experience without 5,000m+ peaks or technical climbing.

bullets.text: Max altitude: 3,880m (Everest View Hotel), minimal AMS risk
Mountain views without extreme altitude - Mount Everest clearly visible
Easy-Moderate trek - accessible for beginners with basic fitness

itinerary_days.title: Arrival in Kathmandu & Briefing
itinerary_days.description: Arrive at Tribhuwan International Airport. EverTrek Nepal representative welcomes you. Afternoon trek briefing focusing on manageable altitudes and Sherpa culture. Explore Kathmandu city.

itinerary_days.title: Fly to Lukla & Trek to Phakding
itinerary_days.description: Early morning scenic 40-minute mountain flight from Ramechap to Lukla (2,800m) - one of the world's most dramatic mountain airports. Trek downhill through rhododendron forests to Phakding (2,600m).

itinerary_days.title: Trek Phakding to Namche Bazaar
itinerary_days.description: Steep ascent with multiple suspension bridges including famous Hillary Bridge over Dudh Koshi River. Challenging morning followed by arrival at Namche Bazaar (3,440m), the Sherpa capital.

itinerary_days.title: Namche - Rest & Acclimatization
itinerary_days.description: Critical acclimatization day at 3,440m. Light walking around Namche: visit Tenzing Norgay Museum, explore vibrant market, shop for trekking gear, relax in local teahouses. Sleep well for recovery.

itinerary_days.title: Namche to Everest View Hotel (3,880m)
itinerary_days.description: Early morning acclimatization hike to Everest View Hotel for first clear view of Mount Everest and surrounding 8,000m peaks. Return to Namche. Both up and down same day.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Namche to Tengboche
itinerary_days.description: Trek northeast through dense rhododendron and conifer forests. Pass Kyangjuma (3,650m). Climb to Tengboche (3,867m) home to famous Tengboche Monastery - one of Nepal's most important Buddhist sites.

itinerary_days.title: Tengboche - Monastery & Acclimatization
itinerary_days.description: Rest day at Tengboche. Visit the famous Tengboche Monastery founded in 1923. Attend evening prayer ceremony if available. Explore monastery grounds with panoramic mountain views. Light walks in area.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Tengboche to Pangboche & Return
itinerary_days.description: Trek down and visit Pangboche Gompa (ancient monastery said to house yeti relics from 300+ years ago). Return uphill to Tengboche. Short physical day but culturally rich.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Tengboche back to Namche
itinerary_days.description: Retrace steps back to Namche Bazaar through rhododendron forests. Descend to 3,440m. Afternoon to relax, shop, and prepare for departure.

itinerary_days.title: Fly Lukla to Kathmandu & Celebration
itinerary_days.description: Trek down to Lukla (3-4 hours). Afternoon scenic return flight to Kathmandu. Evening celebration dinner with EverTrek Nepal team. Share trek stories and photos.

highlights.title: Everest View Hotel - First Everest Glimpse
highlights.description:
Hike from Namche to Everest View Hotel (3,880m) for first clear views of the world's highest peak. See Mount Everest, Lhotse, Nuptse, and Ama Dablam from this spectacular altitude hotel.
Optional lunch and rest at hotel if desired (extra cost).
Photographic paradise for first-time mountain experience.

highlights.title: Tengboche Monastery - Nepal's Holiest Buddhist Site
highlights.description:
Visit famous Tengboche Monastery founded in 1923. One of Nepal's most important Buddhist monasteries with stunning mountain backdrop.
Attend evening prayer ceremonies with resident monks if available.
Experience Sherpa Buddhist culture and spirituality firsthand.
Monastery grounds offer panoramic Everest region views.

highlights.title: Authentic Sherpa Culture - Namche Bazaar Living
highlights.description:
Experience vibrant Namche Bazaar market - the heart of Sherpa trading culture. Shop in local stores, eat in traditional teahouses, meet Sherpa families.
Visit Tenzing Norgay Museum honoring the first Everest summiteer.
Understand Sherpa mountain lifestyle, traditions, and adaptation to high altitude.
Stay in family-run teahouses for genuine hospitality.

highlights.title: Manageable Altitude - No Sickness Risk
highlights.description:
Maximum altitude only 3,880m - well below the 4,000m threshold where acute mountain sickness (AMS) becomes common risk.
Perfect introduction to high-altitude trekking for first-timers.
Build confidence and acclimatization experience before attempting higher passes.
No technical climbing required - pure trekking enjoyment.

cost_and_date_section.intro_text: Everest Panorama Trek is the most affordable and accessible Everest region experience. Perfect for busy professionals, families, and first-time trekkers. Departures available Spring (March-May) and Autumn (September-November). Early booking (6-8 weeks) recommended. Private departures can be customized.

date_highlights.highlight: Spring (March-May): Rhododendron blooms, comfortable temperatures, clear mountain views
Autumn (Sept-Nov): Best visibility, stable weather, ideal hiking conditions
Shortest mountain trek option - only 10 days total
Perfect for busy professionals and family travelers with limited time

questions.question: I'm a complete beginner - can I do this trek?
questions.answer: Absolutely yes! This trek is specifically designed for beginners. Maximum altitude (3,880m) is safe with minimal AMS risk. Easy-Moderate difficulty means good basic fitness is enough (train 2-3 weeks). No technical skills needed. Perfect starter trek.

questions.question: What fitness level is needed?
questions.answer: Moderate fitness. You should be able to walk 4-6 hours daily on uphill terrain. Training 2-3 weeks with hill walking prepares you well. Gym cardio helpful. If you can do weekend 5-10km hikes, you're ready.

questions.question: How does this compare to EBC trek?
questions.answer: EBC trek is longer (13 days), goes much higher (5,400m), and is more challenging. Panorama trek is quick (10 days), safe altitude (3,880m), and easy-moderate difficulty. If unsure about altitude, start with Panorama.

questions.question: Is 10 days enough for Everest region?
questions.answer: Yes! You get full Everest experience: Namche Bazaar culture, Everest View Hotel, Tengboche Monastery, authentic Sherpa hospitality, and mountain views. You won't reach base camp, but you see Everest clearly and experience real Himalayan adventure.

questions.question: Can I extend this to EBC trek?
questions.answer: Yes, you can trek Panorama (10 days), then continue to EBC (additional 6-7 days) for total 16-17 days. Gradual altitude approach makes this safe.

additional_info_sections.heading: Who Should Choose This Trek
articles: Everest Panorama Trek is ideal for: (1) Busy professionals with only 10 days available, (2) First-time mountain trekkers seeking safe introduction to high altitude, (3) Families with teenagers seeking Himalayan adventure without extreme difficulty, (4) Those with fitness limitations but wanting mountain experience, (5) Travelers seeking authentic culture without lengthy high-altitude commitment.

You'll experience everything that makes Everest region special - stunning mountains, authentic Sherpa culture, ancient monasteries, and personal achievement - without the extreme altitude, technical challenges, or lengthy time commitment of longer treks.

bullets.text: Most affordable Everest region option - maximum value
